start.title: The beginning
start.text:
What a beautiful (weekday) afternoon!

You are in your garden, drinking a Salvoy herb tea and enjoying the peaceful ambience. The birds are chirping and the sun is glistening on your pond.

actions.text: Suddenly, `Mika`, one of your best friends, bursts through the gates!
"(name), the crystal has been stolen!", she expresses in distress. "You have to help! You being the (job) and all, please!".
"The mysterious blue crystal, from which kyral energy is absorbed to empower our mages, was taken from us! I think the Galbari are behind this..."

options.text: "The Galbari would never do such a thing!"

actions.text: "Come on, (name), are you listening?!". She desperately tries to gain your attention, waving her thin arms around.

`Mika` raises her left eyebrow in suspicion. "For starters, we have been at war with those *creatures* for quite some time now. Also, in the wrong hands, this crystal could have a devastating impact on the tides in our battles."
Mika leans her head to the side. Her arms are crossed. "Do you really think so or are you just saying that to rile me?"

options.text: "Let's just say we don't know yet."
"No, you are right. It probably was the Galbari people."

actions.text: She approves your statment and resumes the discussion.

"Let's go. We need to get to the castle keep. The king has urgent news about the theft."
`Mika` moves towards your garden door, which still stands open from when she entered.

`Mika` hurries out the front gate and speeds into the alleys, taking the fastest route to the castle's keep.
You follow her.
Once arrived at the keep's drawbridge, two terribly tired looking guards stop you.
"Halt, peasants!" one exclaimed halfheartedly. "No entry allowed without a permit."

options.text: "We heard the king has information about the theft of the blue crystal."

actions.text: "Hm, that's about right, ey, isn't it `Lukas`?" says the second guard, turning towards his colleague.
`Mika` exhales sharply, angered. "Let us in already! I'm from the academy, my name is Mika and this here is my friend, (name)!"

The guards exchange uncomfortable looks, but eventually signal the gate master to lower the drawbridge.

You and `Mika` wait anxiously for the bridge to come down.

The great royal hall is devoid of any furniture. Solid marble pillars every ten meters, with guards stationed at every single one of them. Only the king's throne is decorated with flowers.
A couple of chandeliers hang down from black ceiling, bringing at least some light in the otherwise dark room.
The king arises. "Ah, Mika, you have returned. I see you found your *master tracker*?"

options.text: To the king: "Most certainly! For it is I, master tracker (name)!"

actions.text: `Mika` blushes. "Why yes, your expertise as a (job) makes you the perfect fit for this job. You are our best shot", she says nervously.

options.text: "There are probably more capable trackers out there."

actions.text: "Marvelous!", exclaims king `Eral` in excitement. "You, good person, shall find me the magical crystal that has gone missing."
"Ha ha, I see you are a bit nervous!". King `Eral`'s voice is deep and powerful. "Are you up really for this task?"
"Nonsense!", yells king `Eral`. "A person with such experience as a (job) is a reproachless choice for this task."

"Right down to the business, I like it. Eternal glory awaits you for completing this task.

Oh, and a not-so-small amount of 200💰, of course!"
"Excellent". The king `Eral` is convinced to have found the right person.
Ask away, (job).

options.text: "Any leads on where to start searching?"

actions.text: The king scratches his long dark beard. "Well I am no mage, but it is about as large as bear cub and looks vitreous and fragile, with a faint shimmer surrounding the crystal."

The king enters a contemplative pose. "According to the latest information, tracks have been spotted north and west from the city", says king `Eral` after a couple of seconds. "You might find that they are hiding somewhere and are avoiding public places, those cowards!"
"You very well might, (job). Galbari people are no joke, they pose a serious threat to this kingdom". The king expresses concern.

"Alright then. Head out the city gate, then follow the trail either north or west, depending on where your tracking skills lead you."
The king gives you some coins for the journey.

Inventory: +30💰
"Unfortunately, I will not be able to accompany you, for I have urgencies from the academy to tend to. Good look, adventurer!"

You head out the front door, cross the drawbridge and make your way to the city gates.
There aren't many people on the streets, only some beggars and homeless care to stay outside during those dark times.

After some minutes, you arrive at the gate. The dirt road leads straight, but forks after some hundred meters. You move up to the direction sign which is posted at the road junction. It states:

⬆️ Farmino Forest (North)
⬅️ Hogum Hills (West)

The path north leads you through a sparsely wooded forest. Dying trees are more common than healthy ones. The foliage is covered by fallen leaves, often partially rotting.
Apart from occasional animal noises, there isn't much liveliness to this grim place.
It's getting darker. You are acustomed to traveling through the night, though. However, as `Mika` always says: "Never skip a nap".

You venture deeper into the forest. Despite the lack of signs of life, you recognize a silhouette of a man in the distance, off the road. It looks like he is packing heavy load, with lots of bags. The man appears to be alone.
"Approach, traveler, approach! Have a look at my wares", yells the merchant.

options.text: "You are running your business here, out in these woods?"

actions.text:
"Well for you, my dear, I have ...
Zimbaladong! Where are my manners?! I haven't introduced myself. They call me Jeff. And what's your name?

options.text: "You don't need to know my name."

actions.text: "Ah, hi there, (name). Pleasure to meet you", he says in a friendly tone.
"Ah, hi there, Eugene. Pleasure to meet you", he says in a friendly tone.
"Oh my, that's a ferocious name. Pleasure to meet you nonetheless, Graznock", he says in a friendly tone.
"Oh, you are right, of course. No need for that. Anyway, pleasure to meet you, stranger", he says in a friendly tone.
He smiles. "Well, you are a customer, right? So people *are* getting out here". He seems confident.

"As I was saying, I offer the finest and most exquisite of all the strawberry cakes there are. For 15💰 it shall be yours."
 `Jeff` shows you a creatively decorated piece of cake.

You have: (cash)💰.

options.text: "Can you try it first? I'm afraid it could be poisoned."

actions.text:
"Here, it's all yours". `Jeff` gives you the cake.

Inventory: +🍰
`Jeff` is wiggling in excitement. "Of course you can! Here". He hands over a small portion of the cake.
You can clearly see that `Jeff` becomes angry. His uneven head gets more red every second. "Away with you, you ungrateful person!", he yells.

The cake sample tastes flavorful and refreshing. You sense a strong hint of strawberry. It's yummy.

You have: (cash)💰.

"You do not trust a local trader? In times like this, it's already difficult to make a living as a merchant."
He appears to be saddened by the thought of distrust. "Would you reconsider?"

options.text: "Okay, but I want to try it first."

actions.text: "Okay then, farewell". `Jeff` waves goodbye as you return to the road.
Inbetween some bushes and foliage, you settle down and set up a camp. You keep yourself warm at the campfire.
*Crack*! *Crunch*! You wake up in the middle of the night.

There are noises all around the camp. After a closer inspection of your surrounding, you find yourself in the middle of a Goblin ambush!

Goblins: 5
Win chance: average/high

Success! After a tough fight, you emerge as the victor. Bloodied and weary of the combat, you scavenge the battlefield for loot. You do indeed find a magic scroll, with the potential of summoning a fireball.

Inventory: +🔥
Failed! You killed some of the Goblins, but there are still too many.
Success! You manage to barely escape the wickedness of a wild Goblin pack. After a much needed rest, you make your way back to the path.

You continue on the path through the forest. The longer you walk, the less trees you see. Eventually you exit the woods.
In front of you lies an open gras field and in the distance, along the road, you can spot a bridge.
As you approach the bridge, you hear a something gnarling and snarling under the bridge.

actions.title: The Bridge
actions.text: "WUUAAAAHHHH!!" Out from under the bridge jumps a huge troll! He stands three meters tall and blocks the way across the bridge.
"PAY PASSAGE FEE, TINY HUMAN, OR I SMASH", prompts the troll. He certainly does not try to appear angry, though the volume of his voice is defening.

options.text: "How much do I have to give you?"
"Are you hungry for a cake?" (show him 🍰)

actions.text:
The troll answers: "I NEED 30💰, OR I CANNOT LET PASS HUMAN".

You have: (cash)💰

options.text: "I don't have this amount of money."

actions.text:
The troll says: "NO HUNGRY FOR CAKE, IT IS MONEY ME WANTS".

You have: (cash)💰

options.text: "I don't have this amount of money."

actions.text: "NO MONEY NO PASS", exclaims the troll. You stand neither a chance in battle nor in negotiation and must accept your defeat.

options.text: *Avoid troll and continue journey southwest from here.*

actions.text: The troll accepts your fee and lets you cross the bridge. With a lighter purse, you continue your adventure down the road leading north.

As you continue walking north, the land looks more and more arid and abandoned. The ground is no longer grass but sand and gravel. There are weird rock formations scattered around the place. The only trees you can see are some dark, parched ones.

After some time, you can spot another person walking on the road. in the opposite direction you are walking. You figure this person to be a traveler, for he or she has many camping items hanging from his backpack.

"Good day to you, Sir!", he says. "Are you also a traveler?"

His horns and unhuman skin tone are clear indicator that he is a Galbari.

options.text: "Did you steal a blue magical crystal?"

actions.text: "Blimey, what an accusation!" The Galbari traveler is shocked by the amount of mistrust. "I most certainly have not."

options.text: "Sorry. I am looking for the crystal. It could have been anyone who stole it."

actions.text:
"Ah, don't sweat it! A detective at work, nothing to blame here.
I haven't seen the crystal your describing, unfortunately."

"Oooh, terrific! I love it", he answers friendly.

His face suddenly expresses concern.

"Alright then", he answers friendly.

His face suddenly expresses concern.

He puts one of his hands on his stomach. "Not to sound needy, but I haven't eaten in two days, and I could really go for some food right now.", he says.
"Do you happen to have a spare 🍰?"
He rubs his chin, when suddenly his eyes widen and he starts smiling. "I can give you the exact location of the Galbari hideout. Plus if you tell them my name, they will certainly let you in."
"That's a pitty. Well, I wish you a good day, then." He continues his journey and paces off."

"AAARRGGGGHHH!"

"What an evil being you are! Using magic to intimidate a lone traveler..."

".Alright, alright, I will tell you. My name is Sylvip, they will let you in if you tell them I sent you."

`Sylvip` gives you a detailed description of where to find the hideout.

"Delightful, many thanks, stranger!" *Nom, nom, nom...*

"As a 'thank you' I shall tell you the exact location of the hideout of the Galbari people. Tell them 'Sylvip sent you', they will let you in."

`Sylvip` gives you a detailed description of where to find the hideout.

You move away from the Galbari traveler and continue your path on the road. Some time later, you find yourself in a densly wooded area. This would make a good hideout location. They must be in here somewhere. You comb your way through the foliage.

actions.title: The Hideout
actions.text: After a considerable amount of time later, you find the entrance to the Galbari hideout. It is well hidden, with leaves and vines covering the wooden walls. There are a couple of soldiers standing guard at the gate.
"Halt!", one of the guards yells. "What are you doing here?", she asks.

options.text: "I'm a humble (job) and need a roof over my head for the night. Can you let me in?"
"I'm a humble (job) and need a roof over my head for the night. Can you let me in?"
"I'm a humble (job) and need a roof over my head for the night. Can you let me in?"
"I'm a humble (job) and need a roof over my head for the night. Can you let me in?"

actions.text: "Ah, yes, Sylvip. A good fellow, he is. Come on in, then." The second guard opens the gates for you and lets you pass.

"Ooh, a huntsman, right? I love it. Having an understanding of nature and being a careful hunter, that's what it's all about."

You clearly win favor with the Galbari guards. They let you pass.

"A bard, out here? Wonderful! I bet you can play some party songs. Please join us later at the campfire, when it gets dark. I want to hear some music!"

You clearly win favor with the Galbari guards. They let you pass.

"What?! A warrior? We hate the whole plate-armored rabble, with their oversized weapons! You will never enter this camp alive!"

You clearly lost favor with the Galbari guards. Prepare to fight.

Galbari guards: 3
Win chance: average

"What?! A wizard? We hate the whole robe-wearing rabble, with their pointy hats! You will never enter this camp alive!"

You clearly lost favor with the Galbari guards. Prepare to fight.

Galbari guards: 3
Win chance: average
Success! You bested those Galbari guards. You can now enter the camp and continue your quest unhindered.
Success! You bested those Galbari guards. You can now enter the camp and continue your quest unhindered.
You made it inside. A quick tour around the camp gives you a good overview of the place. There is no one else here.
You made it inside. A quick tour around the camp gives you a good overview of the place. The three guards appear to be the only weaponized Galbari.
You check the insides of all tents. There it is! The crystal!
You check the insides of all tents. There it is! The crystal!
You got it! Now the only thing you have to do is get out of here. Some sort of distraction would work best, in order to avoid combat.

options.text: *Don't use a distraction. Engage in combat.*

actions.text: You got it! Now the only thing you have to do is get out of here. Easy, now that all guards are dead.

You choose to use the obtained fireball scroll to create a distraction. You ignite the tent and sneak out.
After some time, think black smoke emerges from the tent, followed by hissing red flames.

All of the guards speed towards the *accident* and try to contain the fire.

This is your chance!

You choose to use the obtained bell to create a distraction. You sneak out the tent and throw the bell over the walls as far as you can.
At that moment, all the guards speed towards the *strange* noise to investigate. They leave the gate unmanned.

This is your chance!
You made it out! The guards didn't notice your escape!
You begin your journey back to the castle. It is a long way to home.
It is getting dark and you are tired from the events of today.
You set up a camp and lay yourself next to the crackling fire. It is warm and cozy. You take deep and peaceful slumber.
What's a little walk through the night after all that happened today? You continue on the road back to the castle.
You arrived at the city gates and make your way to the drawbridge. The two guards are still looking tired. However, they recognize you immediately and wave from afar.
"Welcome back, adventurer! Were you able to retrieve the crystal?", one asks.

"Brilliant, ey, Lukas! Told you so!", exclaims the other guard to `Lukas`.

The drawbridge is lowered and you can go inside.

"Ey, Lukas! Private affairs, mate! Leave the man be, this is a royal matter, eh!", exclaims the other guard to `Lukas`.

The drawbridge is lowered and you can go inside.
You enter the royal hall. `Mika` is sitting on the floor next the to throne, reading a book, and the king seems to be brooding over something.
"Ha, there you are!" `Mika` jumps up and joins you. "I knew you could do it!"
"My god, you really did it! A proper lad, you are. Here are 200💰! We shall never forget what you did for this kingdom!"

You decide to go west. The area is grassy, but looks arid. The plants have a yellowish, dry color. 
While walking, you are wondering about why the Galbari have horns...
It's getting darker. You are acustomed to traveling through the night, though. However, as `Mika` always says: "Never skip a nap".
You follow `Mika`'s advise and set up a tent and start a camp fire. The night sky is clear and you can see thousands of shiny white dots, scattered across the black void above you.
You wake up the next morning. A fresh breeze grazes your sleepy face.
It is an unusually dark sky tonight. As you walk down the road, you can hear some noise coming from your right side.

In fact, you spot a torch-light in the near distance, casting shadows of two men... Bandits!
They charge at you, now screamingly.

Bandits: 2
Win chance: average/high

Success! You showed those two depredators who the boss is. You scavenge the corpses for loot. You do indeed find a pickaxe, amongst otherwise useless items.

Inventory: +⛏️

Failed! You stand defeated. They took some of your money.

Inventory: -15💰
Success! You barely manage to escape those two depredators. It is now time for a much needed rest.

The next morning, you figure that during the escape from the bandits, you must have drifted north instead of west.

You can see that the road ahead leads to a bridge.
The next morning, you continue on your path to find and recover the crystal.

The road you walk on is uneven and not well cared for.

There! At last, you find some Galbari footprints!
The footprints are leading forward for some time, until eventually, they split into two pairs of tracks. One goes right, off road, and the other continues straight.
You choose to follow the set of prints that lead off the road, into some thicket. As you struggle through the foliage, you spot a distant cave entrance, barricated with wooden planks.
The planks are only loosely attached to a wooden frame surrounding the cave entrance. You figure it must be an old Galbari mine. It looks deep and dark.

You make your way into the mine. You wish you had a lantern, everything is quite dark. Only occasional air shafts bring some light into the cave

After some minutes, you reach a dead-end. A big boulder blocks the path.
It appears, that you could use some sort of tool to remove the blockage, though.

options.text: I don't have any tools. *Return back to the road.*

actions.text: What a cake-walk! With that pickaxe, you make pebble stone out of that boulder.
Well, the cave ends here, but the effort was not for naught: You see a treasure chest at the end of the cave!

Wow! A bell! This would make a great tool for distraction!

Inventory: +🔔
You return back from the cave to the main road and continue to follow the other set of tracks.
The trail of footprints leads into a densly wooded area. This would make a good hideout location. They must be in here somewhere. You comb your way through the foliage.
Ooof! You died in combat. Better luck next time!
Congratulations. You reclaimed the crystal and completed the game!
This game is nothing for lazy people! You are an adventurer. Man up and take the job!
